column4: I have a question, how do I use Ubuntu to share Comcast cable Internet with other PC's in my house?
I have a question, how do I use Ubuntu to share Comcast cable Internet with other PC's in my house?
You have 2 NIC in a box?
not yet but I have an extra NIC here.
You don't need to run it all as root either, just sudo su -   or the equivelent sudo switch which I currently forget
thanks :) Can I use IP aliasing instead of two NIC's? The extra NIC I have is 10mbit...kinda sad considering I get 8mbit from comcast with powerboost up to 20mbit.
If you have some intermediate switch both boxes are in I thnk it would work
yeah, its all hooked up to a hp gigabit switch.
A better explanation than whats there or in the manpage http://www.pageresource.com/cgirec/chmod.htm
thought id have to mess with special permissioms but the default takes care of it
It's good to be conservative with permissions and use 777 sparingly
yeah, its a question on a college assignment heh couldnt figure it out since the teachers likes to be an ass and make the questions confusing
ive been a systems admin for a couple years now, rarely do i use 777 :)
Because write access to all users is not also execute or read access
yeah but 777 is the only thing that fit well so i went with it, 50/50 so mustve been right heh
Techically the correct answer would be 222
